item.title: At least some Democrats are trying to figure out what went wrong
item.description: Democrats’ assessment of why they’re losing voters is healthy, but is the party willing to change?

item.description: As treasure hunters pursue gold and silver, they both aid and compete with archeologists.

item.description: The U.S. is dismantling its best tools to counter Chinese, Russian and Iranian propaganda.

item.description: Do our colleagues side with U.S. consumers or back the president’s economically damaging policy?

item.description: Trump’s residential immodesty is nothing compared with his anti-constitutional immodesty.

item.title: This Supreme Court decision could basically guarantee higher inflation
item.description: When politicians meddle in monetary policy, inflation inevitably follows.

item.title: The real enemy of Hamas lies in a Gaza safe zone
item.description: Pair security with jobs and fair rule so that hope can take root — and drive out Hamas.

item.description: Chicago shows how humor can bring people together in a chaotic world.

item.description: Memphis should focus on smart fixes to clear court backlogs and reduce violence.

item.description: Attacks against alleged drug boats are lawless.

item.description: Cameroonian President Paul Biya epitomizes the anachronistic “Big Man” who is holding back his country.
